DOC.brief_summary: The aim of the study is to compare the time of home discharge in day-case patients receiving either a spinal anesthesia or a combined sciatic-femoral nerve block for knee arthroscopy
DOC.brief_title: Spinal Anesthesia Versus Combined Sciatic-femoral Nerve Block for Outpatient Knee Arthroscopy
DOC.detailed_description: Two groups: the first receive a spinal anesthesia injecting 2% hyperbaric prilocaine 40 mg with the patients in lateral decubitus and the surgical limb declive, the second a combined ultrasound-guided sciatic-femoral nerve block injecting 25 ml of 2% mepivacaine solution. Onset time, performance time, duration of the block, time of voiding, as well as the time of home discharge will be evaluated.
DOC.criteria: outpatients knee arthroscopy diabetes allergy to local anesthetic patient refusal chronic opiods assumption
